pros: Overall wellbeing is good and caring

job_title: Senior Assistant Manager in Jurong East New Town,
pros: Helpful co-workers, friendly environment, conveniently located between few malls.
cons: Management is always cutting manpower, causing staff to stay back and overwork too frequently. Management only cares about KPI. There is also this cultural where you get to do other people’s work just because they do a lousy job (instead of pushing them to improve).

pros: Lots of safety measures and practices
cons: Busy work schedules and tight timelines

Long working hours
Nil acknowledgement of education level achieved

pros: You will have lots of walking exercise as the place is huge and lengthy. Good amenities. Going to work to and fro, you have the link to use the Big Box link to reach work. H.R are wonderful people who care for you. If you never used your yearly medical benefits it can be a channel to your CPF Medisave account on the following year.
cons: MRT very crowded at Jurong. Lots of walking unless not required. Do not expect to park your car there, if you own one.

review_title: Good or bad depends on what you want
pros: Good work life balance for my department.
cons:
Large variance in workload across departments. 
Promotion depends heavily on years served (3 yrs min). Where exceptions are granted, it is because the staff's boss high rank. 
Biggest obstruction to getting work done is other departments who will deny your request for information or make the whole process so cumbersome that you will not embark on it.

pros: Frequently upgrading course and free buffet lunches. It is a new company and thus the experience of the higher executive mainly are from other hospitals.
cons: Different hospitals has different culture and way of doing things. A direct supervisor can hold alot of titles without sharing. Too much foreign talents employedfor high positions and lack of chance for Singaporeans to advance higher.

review_title: Like a startup with high turnover
pros: Location - if you're staying in the west. Anywhere else would be a pain to travel, especially if you're staying in the east.
cons: Long hour redoing same pieces of work because of indecisive bosses. Long hours for low pay. Temperamental bosses (of depending on the department you're in). Tons of unproductive meetings per week - more time is spent on preparing for meetings than doing actual work.

pros: The cardiac department has reasonable working hours and good working environment with colleagues. Provides good learning opportunity for junior staff
cons: Poor management as the hospital is a newly established hospital. High turn over rates shows that staffs are not satisfied

pros: They provide generous annual leave, in-house training, new building.  Located next to train station, convenient and accessible to many food outlet and restaurants.
cons: It is too bureaucratic and too much red tape.  Poor management skills of senior management.  Management does not practice what they preach and out of sync of the corporate value.

pros: People are fantastic to work with
cons: A lot of red tapes makes progress of work difficult

job_title: Executive in Jurong East New Town,
pros:
friendly colleagues
good work life balance
cons: slow progression and expanded job scope

job_title: Manager in Jurong West New Town,
